result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay costs through Clerk of Courts within 60 days or set payment plan.

timeConds.notes: Shall serve 40 hours community service each year/80 hours total.

superMiscConds.notes: Shall be actively involved in (weekly) treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Shall pay any balance remaining as previously ordered during term of supervision.
Shall pay Restitution as ordered in 16CM219 in WEEKLY payments.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Hill
Current: 1414 Sunnyridge Rd  #1, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2016)
Prior: c/o Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Called cases 15CF107 and 16CM219. Defendant Matthew J Hill in court, in custody with attorney David G Makovec.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Pam Charvet appears by telephone. Court heard, will discuss revocation, all parties received summary, parties offer no corrections/deletions. Atty Tienstra heard regarding revocation, would like to wrap up both matters at once, but scheduling was an issue for Atty Wineke, who withdrew, Atty Makovec now on the case. Atty Makovec heard, was just appointed as replacement counsel, no plea negotions in the CM case have occurred between him and Atty Tienstra prior to today, is not comfortable to entering plea and sentencing on that matter today. Ct. heard, may be best to wrap up both cases in one sentencing hearing, Atty Makovec should be given time to work on this matter, court finds victims rights compliance, resets hearing.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
